author: Staff Reporter
text:
M. Rajendran (55) of Keela Pandavaramangalam, a watchman of a private water supply company, suffered injuries after an explosive material burst on Monday. The incident occurred while he was cleaning the premises of the company at Pandavarmangalam, sources said.

The watchman suffered injuries on his both legs. He was admitted to Kovilpatti Government Headquarters Hospital and later he was referred to Tirunelveli Government Medical College Hospital. Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis inspected the spot and held enquiries with those present at the sight. Sources said the watchman had enmity with Subash and Krishnakumar and they were suspected behind the incident. Kovilpatti Deputy Superintendent of Police S. Murugavel said the explosive material that seemed like a country bomb burst when the watchman was filling water in a bucket. He said based on a complaint lodged by the watchman, Kovilpatti west police have filed a case.

The incident occurred while he was cleaning the premises of the company
title: Watchman hurt as explosive goes off
